channel.title: Tor Browser 4.0
channel.description:
...gives a not workin grafical Browser with so many Issues on VB-Script! So, what do you think on?
With best Regards!
townsend

item.title: Tor Browser 4.0
item.dc:creator: townsend
item.description:
Yes, i think too. Its a skin problem.

[quote=“Patrick, post:8, topic:629”]Please compare with plain Debian.

Compared them with a TBB inside plain Debian. Looks the same.

If it also looks the same for you, then you could report a non-Whonix related bug against torproject.org.

I think it’s just a skin thing.[/quote]

Best Regards!

townsend

Read full topic

item.title: Tor Browser 4.0
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Please compare with plain Debian.

Compared them with a TBB inside plain Debian. Looks the same.

If it also looks the same for you, then you could report a non-Whonix related bug against torproject.org.

I think it’s just a skin thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Tor Browser 4.0
item.dc:creator: townsend
item.description:
No, i must excuse me. I mean the graphical vertical Stripes on the Tab.

With best Regards!

townsend

Read full topic

item.title: Tor Browser 4.0
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Ah. Excuse me! I somehow mixed them up.

[quote=“townsend, post:3, topic:629”]http://www.imagesup.net/?di=2141445674013

The Vertical Stripes![/quote]
You mean the red ones on the very left? Not an issue. That’s the NoScript logo. See also:

Whonix – 3 May 20

Tor Browser Basics

Using Tor Browser in Whonix ™. Anonymity vs Pseudonymity, HTTPS Everywhere, Torbutton, Protection against dangerous JavaScript, NoScript, Tips, Update Tor Browser, Browser Plugins, Change Language

Read full topic

item.title: Tor Browser 4.0
item.dc:creator: townsend
item.description:
Dear Adrelanos. The Image-Link are not the same! So i have Problems with the vertical Stripes who was a VB Problem. Tor Browser Bundle Problem (Visual Basic Script) ?

Patrick:

Please use only 1 thread per issue. Since it’s the same sceenshot, it’s probably the same issue. Thread https://www.whonix.org/forum/index.php/topic,668 suffices?

Best Regards

townsend
